examples: When the boss criticized the team's performance, one of the employees reminded him to sweep before his own door and evaluate his own leadership skills.
The school's infrastructure was evaluated and given a clean bill of health, with no major structural or safety issues found
Economists evaluate the effectiveness of a healthcare system on three criteria: Access, Cost, and Quality.
We just evaluated our function.
The two women were being evaluated for epilepsy surgery at University Hospital in Geneva, Switzerland.
words.defineEn: to calculate the amount, importance, number, or value of something or someone
words.defineVi: để tính toán số lượng, tầm quan trọng, số lượng, hoặc giá trị của một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: Risk evaluation is a complicated tangle of statistical thinking and personal preference.
Then they'll have an evaluation.
For the new class, their first week focuses on a physical evaluation.
In real life, everyone’s individual evaluation of risk will vary depending on their personal circumstances.
Instead, the experimenters came back with 3 fake evaluations from others who had supposedly seen their data.
words.defineEn: a judgment on the quantity and quality of anything after carefully considering
words.defineVi: một đánh giá về số lượng và chất lượng của bất cứ điều gì sau khi xem xét cẩn thận

words.defineEn: relating to forming or giving an opinion about the qualities or values of something upon adequate consideration
words.defineVi: liên quan đến việc hình thành hoặc đưa ra ý kiến về phẩm chất hoặc giá trị của một cái gì đó khi xem xét đầy đủ

examples: Candidates will sit the examinations in June.
US President Joe Biden got the clean bill of health on Friday after a detailed physical examination.
A lot of examination to come over these votes.
But closer examination has revealed that salps are actually an incredibly important food source for hundreds of species of marine animals.
Science, however, did not figure much into these state examinations.
words.defineEn: the process of looking closely at something to see if there are any issues
words.defineVi: quá trình xem xét kỹ một cái gì đó để xem có vấn đề gì không

examples: The doctor examined her neck for any signs of injury.
The doctor examined her body to check for any signs of illness or injury.
She examined the pith under a microscope to study its cellular structure.
We examined the caryopsis of the rice grain under the microscope, observing its unique structure.
She examined the potato closely, noticing the small eye where a new sprout would eventually emerge.
words.defineEn: to analyze someone or something in detail
words.defineVi: để phân tích một ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó chi tiết

examples: Expecting eight guests all told.
Expect these changes to happen soon.
The company's new product launch is expected to do well in the market.
The novel was expected to sell between 1 000 and 1 500 copies.
Thousands of firms are expected to go to the wall this year.
words.defineEn: to think or believe that it is possible for something to happen or for someone to do something
words.defineVi: suy nghĩ hoặc tin rằng điều gì đó có thể xảy ra hoặc ai đó có thể làm điều gì đó

examples: Researchers can then extrapolate details about the planet’s size and orbit based on the magnitude and regularity of that dip.
From the MAVEN data, they extrapolated back one billion years.
They can then extrapolate that and get a good idea of the overall health of the ecosystem.
You can extrapolate to 3, but when we're getting the intuition, it's good to do it in 2.
But there are a few things we can extrapolate.
words.defineEn: to estimate something using the information that one has
words.defineVi: để ước tính một cái gì đó bằng cách sử dụng thông tin mà một người có

examples: In fact, according to mathematical extrapolations, respiration doesn’t top out until 60 or 70 degrees Celsius!
It could be that astronomers have been calculating the telescope extrapolations wrong.
Those extrapolations are all based on, like, really well-tested laws of physics, so you would think these results would match up pretty well with what we’ve observed with instruments like Hubble.
Or, at least, if they want to make extrapolations based on what they observe, they have to be super careful, because the trait they’re looking at might be completely dependent on context.
words.defineEn: the act of using known facts or existing trends in order to conclude or estimate something assuming that the current trends or facts will remain relevant
words.defineVi: hành động sử dụng các sự kiện đã biết hoặc các xu hướng hiện có để kết luận hoặc ước tính điều gì đó với giả định rằng các xu hướng hoặc sự kiện hiện tại sẽ vẫn phù hợp

words.defineEn: (of an estimate or method) unscientific or inaccurate
words.defineVi: (của một ước tính hoặc phương pháp) không khoa học hoặc không chính xác

examples: Church officials today forecast red ink of nearly $60 million this year.
J.C. Penney withdrew its financial forecast.
A 2019 Morgan Stanley report forecasted that the market for high speed travel could reach 800 billion dollars in annual sales by 2040.
The forecast does not include the COVID relief package now under consideration.
Economists have been baking into their forecasts a slowdown of economic growth.
words.defineEn: to predict the coming events, based on the existing information
words.defineVi: để dự đoán các sự kiện sắp tới, dựa trên thông tin hiện có

examples: Church officials today forecast red ink of nearly $60 million this year.
J.C. Penney withdrew its financial forecast.
A 2019 Morgan Stanley report forecasted that the market for high speed travel could reach 800 billion dollars in annual sales by 2040.
The forecast does not include the COVID relief package now under consideration.
Economists have been baking into their forecasts a slowdown of economic growth.
words.defineEn: a prediction of what will happen such as a change in the weather
words.defineVi: một dự đoán về những gì sẽ xảy ra chẳng hạn như một sự thay đổi trong thời tiết

words.defineEn: to immediately comprehend or guess something in the first try
words.defineVi: để ngay lập tức hiểu hoặc đoán một cái gì đó trong lần thử đầu tiên

words.defineEn: to carefully assess someone's character or qualities, or to form an opinion about something
words.defineVi: cẩn thận đánh giá tính cách hoặc phẩm chất của ai đó, hoặc hình thành ý kiến về điều gì đó

examples: Check out the giveaway link in the video description.
There's a giveaway.
This giveaway will be open for two weeks.
Well, the first giveaway was the animal’s hips.
But the giveaway is that we have the same degree in the numerator and the denominator.
words.defineEn: something that inadvertently reveals something or makes something easy to guess
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó vô tình tiết lộ một cái gì đó hoặc làm cho một cái gì đó dễ đoán

examples: She guessed the answer straight away.
"Your guess is as good as mine."
Surely she would guess the truth.
He had already guessed the answer.
Far from eye, far from heart, I guess.
words.defineEn: to consider something as true without being sure
words.defineVi: để coi một cái gì đó là đúng mà không chắc chắn

examples: She guessed the answer straight away.
"Your guess is as good as mine."
Surely she would guess the truth.
He had already guessed the answer.
Far from eye, far from heart, I guess.
words.defineEn: an attempt to give an answer without having enough facts
words.defineVi: một nỗ lực để đưa ra một câu trả lời mà không có đủ sự thật

examples: Unfortunately, this can be a bit of a guessing game.
It wasn’t a total guessing game, but it wasn’t a science, either.
So, let’s play a guessing game.
You hear noise and it’s still a guessing game.
We're also gonna play an Olympic face guessing game later.
words.defineEn: *** a situation in which you do not know what is going to happen or what somebody is going to do
words.defineVi: *** một tình huống mà bạn không biết điều gì sắp xảy ra hoặc ai đó sẽ làm gì

examples: Guesstimate your business expenses.
I would guesstimate that it was leading out of the stomach.
Or even better, guesstimating this.
I think that there was a bit of a ballpark guesstimate on the website, but it wasn't official.
So I'm just gonna, kinda guesstimate where that last, that last cervical is and cut into the muscle.
words.defineEn: an attempt made to estimate or calculate something without knowing all the facts
words.defineVi: một nỗ lực được thực hiện để ước tính hoặc tính toán một cái gì đó mà không biết tất cả các sự kiện

examples: For a long time, advertising was an art of guesswork.
This isn’t guesswork: the math and physics bear this out.
It was pretty much a load of garbage and guesswork, and many scientists were vocal critics.
That doesn't mean that economics is all guesswork.
I’ll just tell you straight up and leave the guesswork out of it: If you’re a fan of free resources for science education, we like you a lot.
words.defineEn: the process of guessing something due to insufficient information; the result of this process
words.defineVi: quá trình đoán một cái gì đó do không đủ thông tin; kết quả của quá trình này

examples: Most home givers aren't receiving hazard pay.
A big hazard is a dependency in the instructions.
And the blowtorch comes with fire hazards.
Vidale: Historically, they biggest hazard from earthquakes has been fire.
It's a fire hazard.
words.defineEn: to state an opinion, guess, suggestion, etc. even though there are chances of one being wrong
words.defineVi: để đưa ra một ý kiến, phỏng đoán, gợi ý, v.v. mặc dù có khả năng sai

words.defineEn: to succeed in achieving the desired result
words.defineVi: để thành công trong việc đạt được kết quả mong muốn

examples: The weather was disagreeably hot.
The news came hot on the heels of another plane crash.
The factory closure follows hot on the heels of several others
The winter issue is hot off the press.
That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
words.defineEn: used specifically in children’s games to say that someone is getting close in guessing the correct answer or finding a hidden person or object
words.defineVi: được sử dụng cụ thể trong các trò chơi của trẻ em để nói rằng ai đó đang tiến gần đến việc đoán câu trả lời đúng hoặc tìm thấy người hoặc đồ vật bị giấu

examples: The scientist understood that every bean has its black, and that even the most promising hypothesis may have flaws that need to be addressed and overcome.
However his massive collection of drawings supported his hypothesis from every angle.
So, this hypothesis makes sense.
P-values, by definition, only examine null hypotheses.
We develop a hypothesis.
words.defineEn: an explanation based on limited facts and evidence that is not yet proved to be true
words.defineVi: một lời giải thích dựa trên các sự kiện và bằng chứng hạn chế chưa được chứng minh là đúng

examples: She imagined a sunny day at the beach, enjoying a scoop of lemon curd ice cream.
Imagine two criminals, partners in crime, who are arrested and placed in separate cells with no means of communication.
She imagined kids making funny faces after trying scorzonera for the first time.
She imagined a magical land where the trees were made of cotton candy and the rivers flowed with white sugar.
He imagines himself as a chef, creating a masterpiece dish with Calabrese as the star ingredient.
words.defineEn: to have confidence or faith in the truth or existence of something without absolute proof or certain knowledge
words.defineVi: có niềm tin hoặc niềm tin vào sự thật hoặc sự tồn tại của một cái gì đó mà không có bằng chứng tuyệt đối hoặc kiến thức nhất định

examples: The judge will have the last word on the divorce agreement.
The judge allowed my claim.
The judge brought his hammer down on the table.
The judge stood firm in her ruling.
People often judge a book by its cover without reading the contents.
words.defineEn: to form an estimation about the size, amount, etc. of something
words.defineVi: để hình thành một ước tính về kích thước, số lượng, vv của một cái gì đó
